frameDefinitions: A particular piece of Information is evaluated for its accuracy.
This frame contains adjectives and nouns that describe the truth or sincerity of communication.
An Agent or a Cause mentally or physically expends energy rendering an Input, whether implicit or explicit, into a Output.
This frame concerns an Evaluee being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked.

A Phenomenon is portrayed with respect to the Degree of likelihood that it will  be perceived and known, given the (usually implicit) Evidence, Perceiver, and the Circumstances in which it is considered.
An Entity stands out perceptually in comparison to other members of its type.
frameExamples: Is your reputation at risk due to <t>incorrect</t> information?
Evelyn was <t>candid</t> with me about the party.
Erosion is the <t>work</t> of wind and water on rock.
It's abundantly <t>obvious</t> that we'll need to spend more time on public perception.
Pilot Mountain in NC is very <t>prominent</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the agent who holds the correct/incorrect information.
The event which communicates the <fen>Information</fen>.
The Topic about which the Source has accurate information.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Information</fen> or the <fen>Source</fen> is correct.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen>, the truth or sincerity of which is at issue. It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word, or as the Nominal Head of prenominal uses.

<fen>Message</fen> is the communicative content whose truth or sincerity is at issue. This role does not normally co-occur with the other FEs in this frame. When it does occur, it is normally the External Argument of a predicative use of the <t>Target</t> word, or the modified Nominal Head in a prenominal use.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It often occurs without the <fen>Message</fen> role in predicative uses of the <t>target</t> word. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
A sentient entity whose physical and mental faculties are directly expended on the <fen>Input</fen> to create the <fen>Output</fen>.
A non-sentient entity whose physical faculties are directly expended on the <fen>Input</fen> to create the <fen>Output</fen>.
The mental or physical faculties onto which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> expends energy.
The end product, either a concept or physical object onto which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> has exerted its mental or physical faculties from the rudimentary state of <fen>Input</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Output</fen> was committed into reality.
The place where the <fen>Output</fen> was birthed.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
This role marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
The entity or facts that are undeniable given the <fen>Evidence</fen>.
The gradable aspect of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> which concerns how likely it is that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> be known. This frame element is incorporated by the lexical units in this frame.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Phenomenon</fen> in terms of how likely the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> would be known.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is obvious
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the saliency <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
The feature of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion, namely perceptual salience.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular salience.
This role refers to the location where the <fen>Entity</fen> has a prominence of some <fen>Attribute</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Evelyn made some candid remarks <fex>in French</fex>.
The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex>in freshness</fex>.
It is obvious for example <fex>that 9/10 is not the same as 1</fex>.
It is <fex>abundantly</fex> obvious you have not a clue how the Retro Program works.
It is obvious <fex>now</fex> that Senator O. T. Tawa has no plan.
If you are asked to search for the plus sign with red-vertical and green-horizontal elements, <fex>all the red and green plus signs</fex> may seem to become salient.
The diagram, (a frequency distribution chart) shows a <fex>prominently</fex> conspicuous region of stars that extend from the extremely bright and hot stars to the faint and cool variety.
The affection for American culture seemed more prominent <fex>last year</fex>.
